algorithm_technique: Sort points by x-coordinate and use a greedy approach to place rectangles.
problem_summary_simple: Cover all points with the minimum number of horizontal rectangles of a fixed width.
problem_summary_technical: Sort points by x-coordinate. Greedily extend the current rectangle's right boundary as far as possible.
key_insights: Sorting by the x-coordinate is crucial for the greedy strategy.
The key is to extend each rectangle as far right as possible to cover subsequent points.
The y-coordinate of the points does not influence the placement strategy, only the x-coordinate and width matter.
